column2: We are seeking an experienced and detail-oriented Senior HRIS Administrator to join our dynamic People Operations team. As an individual contributor, you will play a critical role in managing our HR systems, ensuring data accuracy, and driving process efficiency. Reporting directly to the People Operations Director, you will have end-to-end ownership of our HR technology landscape, including system architecture, integrations, and automation initiatives. Your expertise will be instrumental in enhancing our employee experience and optimising HR processes.           What will you DO:         HR Systems Ownership: Take full responsibility for the design, implementation, integration, administration, maintenance and support of our HR systems. This includes managing the entire lifecycle, from requirements gathering to post-implementation support.   Data Governance: Maintain data integrity, security, and compliance within our HR systems. Regularly audit data, identify discrepancies, and collaborate with relevant stakeholders to rectify any issues.     Systems Architecture: Develop and maintain a robust systems architecture that aligns with our business needs. Ensure scalability, reliability, and seamless integration across platforms.   Systems Administration: Administer and maintain our People systems and ensure appropriate coverage for periods of planned and unplanned absence. This includes maintaining system documentation, process documentation, our knowledge base, and training materials to ensure these are in line with the latest system functionality.     HRIS Roadmap: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to create and deliver a strategic roadmap for our HRIS that is aligned with our operational goals, transformation programmes and organisational strategy. Identify opportunities for enhancement, evaluate new features, and drive continuous improvement.     Process Automation: Implement process automation solutions to streamline HR workflows. Leverage technology to reduce manual tasks, improve efficiency, and enhance user experience.   Change Control and Release Management: Lead change management efforts related to system upgrades, enhancements, and patches. Communicate changes effectively to end users and provide necessary training.     Vendor Management: Manage relationships with HR technology vendors. Evaluate existing contracts, negotiate renewals, and assess new vendor requirements.   Systems Implementation: Manage the implementation of new systems, upgrades and releases. This role is responsible for forming cross-functional teams to ensure that the system requirements are well defined and meet stakeholders needs. This role would partner with procurement and other key stakeholders to select the right vendor, and then would take the lead on managing the project and implementing the changes. This could be in the capacity as an internal project manager, data migration specialist, performing and/or coordinating user testing, integration support, system configuration, and/or 3rd party vendor management, depending on the scope of the project.     Role Based Permissions: Ensure user roles are well defined to meet stakeholder needs and ensure compliance with data access minimisation principles, GDPR and any other relevant organisational and legislative controls. Ensure new users are onboarded and terminated users offboarded within 24 hours of their start/termination date. Ensure roles are assigned based on positions rather than names. Regularly audit the system to review that roles are still correctly assigned, and test system changes to ensure that roles are still compliant.     System Issues and Support: Provide People team and end-user support on systems issues, including troubleshooting and resolving configuration issues, data issues, integration issues, system outages, and system understanding, ensuring quick response and resolution times and a high-quality, well-tested resolution. Ensure users are kept informed of the status of any outstanding items. Escalate and follow up with product vendors and internal responsible parties as needed to see through an issue to resolution.     Testing and Quality Assurance:Conduct thorough testing of system updates, integrations, and new features prior to releasing features into production. Ensure smooth transitions and minimal disruption to end users.     Vendor Management: Work with vendors to escalate and resolve product-level issues and understand their product roadmaps and additional value this could offer Advanced. Maintain a record of all contracts, change orders, contract end dates. Actively discuss renewal strategies with key stakeholders well in advance of contract renewal dates.     Case Management and SLAs: Develop internal SLAs for system activities and deliver activities in accordance with SLAs. Ensure our case management tool is used to manage requests and changes. Develop efficiency metrics and reporting, and a regular process to evaluate these and take action to improve outcomes. Regularly monitor ticket themes and content and implement actions to continually reduce ticket volumes (e.g. training, knowledge base articles etc.)   Product liaison: For products developed by Advanced that are utilised by the team, regularly meet with the Product teams to provide feedback on the product, review and help influence the roadmap, act as an early adopter for new functionality and help co-design as appropriate.   Manage Change and Adoption: Monitor and report on adoption and experience metrics for our People systems. Ensure any upgrades, releases, system changes, outages and bug fixes are well communicated to the organisation and key stakeholders. Develop clear communication plans for system changes, outages, and updates. Ensure that employees understand the impact and necessary actions. Provide training for any new systems, systems changes, and new users. Regularly perform audits and follow up with the required person for gaps in data or data quality issues within the system.     Partner: with key business stakeholders and People team members to ensure People tools address key business and stakeholder needs.   Retrospectives and Continuous Improvement:Conduct retrospectives to gather insights from system implementations and upgrades. Use feedback to drive improvements and enhance user satisfaction. Actively seek feedback from end users and stakeholders. Address concerns, iterate on processes, and drive positive change.         What will you Have:         Experience working in a fast-paced environment supporting the implementation and administration of global HR systems     Experience with testing and data migration     Experience implementing and administering HR systems     Experience in process mapping, re-engineering and continuous improvement, work instruction and training creation     Strong analytical skillset     Excellent communication and interpersonal skills     Ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams     Strong problem-solving and decision-making skills     Ability to manage multiple priorities and meet deadlines     Strong results-orientation and ability to work effectively and indpendently     Experience in GDPR, data privacy and compliance preferred     Strong analytical skills and attention to detail.     Project management experience is a plus
column11: Procurement, System architecture, Change management, Data migration, Manager Quality Assurance, Project management, Data quality, Troubleshooting, Release management, Auditing

column2: Role & responsibilities   Looking for an Executive of Human Resource Department to join and lead our team. And because we serve more than 40 industries globally, you'll have the opportunity to develop valuable industry-specific expertise. The scale of our capabilities and client engagements-and the unique way we innovate, operate and deliver value-will give you the opportunity to deepen your existing skills even as you help create the latest technology trends.  You'll have access to leading-edge technology. CALL TO ACTION: If you have a desire to help the world's leading companies and governments, now's the time to join the world's largest and most diversified group of technology, business process and consulting professionals. Be part of a dynamic team of collaborative experts, and help us improve the way the world works and lives

column2: Summary  People Advisor Senior Analyst - Transitions (CL10): India Operations is at a critical juncture as we expect huge growth through complex transitions, mega clients and external lateral hiring. We are building a team who will specialize in managing HR Service delivery for these complex transitions and growth. This role of the People Advisor Senior Analyst - Transitions has been thoughtfully crafted to meet the unique demands of all our upcoming re-badgins, re-hirings, complex transitions and all the hiring in pipeline for India Operations. The key measures of success of this role are: a. Smooth transitions. b. All new accounts to start green and stay green from a People Metrics standpoint. c. All new hires assimilated well within Accenture, hence a huge focus on Culture. This role desires intellectual vigor and curiosity partnered with agility rich execution, that brings predictability and reliance in day to day operations. We are scouting for a Field HR expert who can lead the HR Service delivery for all the upcoming re-badgings, rehirings, complex transitions, new hires, thereby demonstrating high levels of: a. Agile Execution b. Change management c. HR Compliance This role will include new hire assimilation, design/implementation of local employee engagement and recognition programs, providing mobility services, planning/delivering training, coaching, mentoring and supervision. Key Responsibilities: Your key responsibilities would be to:  Help the HR leadership in the Total Rewards Total Rewards benchmarking exercise for the rebadgings / rehirings.  Work with the transition teams and HR leadership to execute the communication plan for the rebadgings.  Manage execution of the offer strategy and onboarding in collaboration with business and recruiting teams.  Ensure assimilation and integration of all hires rebadged, new hires. Conduct new joiner orientation for the rebadged / rehired employees.  Execute key HR processes within Field HR, i.e. performance management, exit management, grievance management and career moves through internal role postings.  Ensure high level of connects with all new joiners through 1-0-1s, focus group discussions, brown bag sessions etc.  Coordinate the performance achievement and promotion processes ensuring adherence to timelines and accurate and fair reward decisions  Coordinate with Career Counselors and Managers to enable the implementation of performance improvement plans  Coach and advise Career Counselors to ensure effective delivery of difficult messages.  Review continuously the performance feedback for individuals within remit in order to anticipate and manage potential performance issues.  Proactively monitor personnel issues or situations.  Communicate company-wide initiatives to group supported Qualification: Postgraduate Human Resources Degree or related experience. column2: Job  Summary : Are you passionate about people analytics and enhancing people experiences? Do you thrive in a collaborative & agile environment where you can make a meaningful impact? If so, we have an exciting opportunity for you to join our team as an HR Service Delivery Specialist. This role is housed in HR Service & excellence compliance team which is part of the India Corporate Functions HR team in Accenture. Working with this team provides you with an opportunity to work on complex & large scale HR transformation projects We are seeking a dynamic and experienced individual to join our. In this role, you will play a pivotal role in driving HR transformation initiatives and leveraging analytics skills to understand and provide attrition insights to the leadership. You will work closely with HR leaders, Shared services, process teams and data analytics team to implement solutions, and drive change within the organization. Key Responsibilities: Co-own strategy & solution designing along with the leads of HR transformation projects. Identify areas for improvement and develop strategies to address them. Drive end to end project management including implementation, change management & governance of HR transformation initiatives aimed at enhancing employee experience. Collaborate with Business HR teams and cross-functional teams to drive projects & deliverables. Drive change management efforts to ensure successful adoption of new HR processes, technologies, and practices. Monitor and evaluate the effectiveness of programs and initiatives, making data-driven recommendations for continuous improvement. Build storyboards & proposals to drive effective stakeholder discussions. Utilize analytics skills to analyze attrition data, identify trends, and monitor key metrics related to attrition providing regular reports and actionable insights to HR leadership. Oversee the collection, integration, and management of attrition data from multiple sources, ensuring data accuracy and completeness. Qualification Qualifications & Skills required: Bachelors in any specialization & post-graduates (specialized preferably in HR) from Tier I & II B-schools. 4-7 years of experience in HR transformation, organizational development, HR business partner or related areas, with a focus on driving change and improving employee experience. Strong analytical skills with experience in attrition analysis. Excellent communication and presentation & storyboarding skills, with the ability to translate complex data and insights into actionable recommendations. Demonstrated ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams and influence stakeholders at all levels of the organization. Strong project management skills with the ability to manage multiple initiatives simultaneously and drive them to successful completion. Proficiency in MS excel & PowerPoint.
column11: storyboarding, project management, presentation skills, organizational development, hr transformation, attrition analysis, business hr, change management, employee engagement, service delivery, recruitment, hr processes, performance management

column2: Job description: Talent Futurist Manager Overview -  The Talent Futurist Manager is responsible for Leading programs on skills and experiences of our people and how they align to client demand, with visibility and perspective across services/practices. He/she would be main person working with the Business Leader, Human Resources and all partners to chart the future of skills, employee staffing experience, specialization and multiskilling.  This role is important from the point of view of Business in terms of growth, skills, experience perspective and for Employees in terms of their multiskilling, staffing experience, next career path. The person would need to develop and have deep understanding of Business needs, Business Operating models, technical skills, different channels of Supply like Bench, Roll Offs, Cross Training and reskilling, Recruiting and contracting.  From Employee perspective, this role would need to ensure efficient operating models so that employees are able to move into their aspirational roles. Reskilling employees and rotating them to meet future niche and super niche skill demands would be a high priority.  Talent Futurist Manager would be expected to continuously encourage innovation and rotate the staffing function to the NEW.  What would you do? Your role includes the following key responsibilities. You should review these in conjunction with career level guidelines to gain a clear understanding of the expectations for your role.  Overall Be an advisor to the Market Unit Lead and Market Unit HR Lead on the skills and experiences of our people and how they align to client demand, with visibility and perspective across services/practices Share insights to identify hot and cold spots; propose and support actions to navigate future imbalances of skills/ experience and drive to resolution with Business Lead(s) Work creatively across Accenture to ensure optimization of buy/build/borrow strategies, including collaboration with Recruiting and Learning on future recruiting and new-skilling opportunities Provide points of view on adjacent skills that can be new-skilled for in demand areas that are trending up. Support development of action planning to demand-driven skilling  Connect with the HR Partners to understand our people and practice focuses Connect with Finance and Business Operations to focus on profitable and sustainable talent plans Qualification Who do we need? Minimum 10 years of experience in IT services environment - experience in Recruitment, Staffing, Human Resources would be an advantage Post Graduation would be preferable The person should have a passion for areas around future skills, reskilling, fulfillment, talent programs Good stakeholder management skills Passion towards innovation and rotating processes to the NEW Use Analytics and Data driven Insights to drive Talent Programs Growth Opportunities You'll benefit from our network of global communities and collaborative culture that will help you build technical and functional skills and capabilities. And because we serve more than 40 industries globally, you'll have the opportunity to develop valuable industry-specific expertise.  The scale of our capabilities and client engagementsand the unique way we innovate, operate and deliver valuewill give you the opportunity to deepen your existing skills even as you help create the latest technology trends.  You'll have access to leading-edge technology.

column2: Role Description As I&A On-boarding Information Security Analyst you will be part of Access Lifecycle On-boarding global family which includes access management for application end user recertification On-boarding, user access for request & approval, user provision On-boarding and Segregation of Duties On-boarding & maintenance as well as Identity and Access concept documentation as central DB services. Deutsche Bank is looking for bright and open-minded individuals to support Business Identity & Access Services within Access Lifecycle Solution On-boarding team for application end user request & approval as well as end user access provision central service On-boarding. A key success factor of the Access Lifecycle Solution On-boarding team is the quick understanding of complex application set ups for Identity & Access Management and support Stakeholders throughout end-to-end central solution On-boarding process across DB. You will gain insights into the complete Identity & Access Management lifecycle as you will learn about the roles and entitlements and their set up, segregation of duties, application authentication and authorization process. Your key responsibilities As I&A On-boarding Information Security Analyst you will be responsible to perform On-boarding assessments of an IT asset as applicable for end user application access for request & approval and business requirement gathering (based on existing KOP ID Admin procedures) to identify, how future user provisioning (ID Admin via automated connector or manual, centrally or decentral managed) will be set up between central request & approval platform and to be on-boarded application in adhering to Information Security (IS) internal and regulatory requirements. Efficiently engage, manage, and influence the main stakeholders, along with application On-boarding process including Information Security Officer, IT Application Owner, Engineering and Operations teams Provide process improvement inputs to various stakeholders involved. Proactively seek ways to improve upon existing practices and processes. Display insight and ability in identifying issues and develop successful solutions. Report and escalate potential risks to the management to help avoid minimize the impact. Work with multiple, distributed teams (across different locations) Support develops key operational procedures where necessary and ensure adherence to all such defined policies. Comfortable with associated disciplines of Security Policy and Governance in banking domain Very good presentation and communication skills allowing to communicate with our stakeholders. A structured and methodological way of working with the objective to deliver high quality results. Supports tough people decisions to ensure people performance is aligned with organization imperatives and needs. Addresses individual performance issues, where necessary, to drive for high performance. Pro-active and flexible working approach, Team spirit Your skills and experience Minimum 3 years working experience on Identity & Access Management, Governance, Risk and Control related topics. Basic knowledge and/or willingness to work with industry best practices and frameworks like ISO27001, NIST, CSA CCM, COBIT, ITIL Good business analyses knowledge of system design, development, implementation, and user support principles and practices Knowledge of IT Service Management or IT Governance or IT Delivery Management or IT Project Management or IT Delivery background or IT Security Knowledge on Database Systems, application interactions and server operating systems Excel knowledge Competencies: Self-motivated and flexibility to work autonomously in virtual and multicultural teams. Good communication skills, both written and verbal are fluent in English (written/verbal) Good analytical skills and problem-solving abilities Pro-active and flexible working approach A structured and methodological way of working with the objective to deliver high quality results. Flexible mindset with an eye for detail and continuous improvement Good understanding in business related information Being flexible, open minded, able to share information, transfer knowledge and expertise to stakeholders and other team members.

column2: You will need to understand talent management best practices and how they relate to other HR disciplines.      You will lead global implementation projects with manageable risks and resource requirements, as well as serve as a resource and coach for other colleagues.      You should also be able to explain difficult or sensitive information and work to build consensus with others. Your performance impacts a wide range of stakeholders, operational, project, or service activities within the talent space and other related teams requiring working within established governance, guidelines, and policies.      Role requires a robust talent development network and willingness to provide feedback and guidance to key stakeholders on development programs aligned to Dow s global strategy and governance guidelines. In addition, works closely with other global TM&L specialists, the Talent Center of Expertise (CoE) Team, the Modernizing Workforce Capabilities Program, Regional TM&L teams, HR Directors, the HR Partner network, and Functional Learning & Development Leaders to support an articulated All Employee Development approach.              Responsibilities          Responsible for the global Employee Development Annual Offerings & Coordination. Also accountable for enhancement and innovative projects aligned to the employee development portfolio.      Partners with regional TM&L teams to guarantee global framework and foundations are consistently enabled through local priorities aligned to employee development experience.      Provides continuous consultation support in the employee development journey space across stakeholders (Ex: Business, Functions, OOI & Employee Resource Group (ERG) and EX programs).      Accountable for the Global Education Assistance Program (GEAP/GLEAP) management including governance and run the business execution.      Responsible for the global governance, corporate consultation and run the business management of Coursera learning platform.      Leads annual global execution for the Facilitator Network Program consistently implemented across regions to enable the skill-based development workshop/ course offering.      Provides guidance and expertise consultancy for functional L&D leaders on global strategy and model leverage approach.      Acts as primary point-of-contact for corporate mentorship, coaching and sponsorship foundations, framework and MyHRPortal capabilities to be leveraged out of corporate programs into regional, functional and OOI/EX programs.      Oversights end-to-end solution in MyHRPortal Career Navigation, including Gigs, Mentorships, and data insights space to deliver a best-in-class experience.      Partners with key stakeholders providing consultation and ROI metric inputs on specific Talent Management Programs for requirements such as ESG Intersection Report, Employer Awards/External Reputation reports among others. Works in partnership with regional Employer Awards cross-discipline teams and Global I&D Insights Leader on strategy alignment.      Engage in improving Knowledge Base and Case Management content for assigned scope, based on experience.      Engages in and drives overall continuous improvement processes for the Employee Development Portfolio partnering across Talent Management & Learning aligned to global People and Culture priorities.      Engages with Sourcing team, HR Data Privacy and third-party providers to establish, develop and review the suite of services in the Employee Development portfolio space.              Qualifications          A minimum of a bachelor s degree in Human Resources, Psychology, Business, Statistics, or Related field or relevant military experience at or above a U.S. E6 ranking or Canadian Petty Officer 2nd Class or Sergeant.      A minimum of 3 years experience in talent development and/or focused work including skill-based development program management and execution or relevant experience related to talent programs.      Ability to read, write, and speak English fluently.      Project management experience and or certification.      Ability to multi-task and to work under pressure to tight deadlines, budgets, and targets.      Strong work ethic and willingness to provide top-notch customer service.        For US Applicants Only    : A minimum requirement for this U.S. based position is the ability to work legally in the United States. No visa sponsorship/support is available for this position, including for any type of U.S. permanent residency (green card) process.              Preferred Skills          L&D platform governance and management (ex: Coursera)      ROI metrics implementation experience      Experience on employee development assessments and talent workforce insights.      Experience and familiarity with use of technology such as Workday or similar HRMS, Talent Marketplaces, Learning Management Systems      Oral and written communication with ability to present and communicate effectively at all employee levels.      Strong interpersonal skills for stakeholder management (including external vendors and consultants) are critical.      Strong quantitative, analytical, research and data analysis skills.
column11: Data analysis, Employee development, Project management, Packaging, Customer service, Talent management, Stakeholder management, Continuous improvement, Operations, Team building

column2: This position requires effective leadership and project management skills. The position is responsible for certain aspects of benefit and leave of absence plan administration and requires a knowledge of ERISA and IRS benefit plan regulations.              ?       Essential Job Duties and    Responsibilities:            This position works under limited supervision to ensure proper global benefits administration     Responsible for working with TRISTAR (LOA 3rd Party Administrator for U.S. Leaves) on all U.S. leaves and reviewing and administering all Canadian requests for leave of absences, including analyzing eligibility and providing approval for qualifying leaves     Oversees and approves the Workday benefit events to ensure timely processing/approving     Responsible for supporting the annual U.S. open enrollment which includes: managing Workday configuration and testing to ensure a successful go-live     Work with HRIS on new benefits configuration and problem solve configuration issues     Works with Payroll and Cigna to ensure H.S.A. accounts are established and funded for employees and identify and solve variance and discrepancies in benefit deductions and contributions     Works with the benefit CoE team, insurance carriers and TPAs regarding employee benefit plans and leave administration     Work with vendors on implementing and managing accurate benefit data (ie, eligibility, file feeds, payroll deductions, enrollment, etc)     Manage compliance deadlines (ie, work with payroll, HRIT and HRIS to collect and arrange nondiscrimination testing data submittal, audit request, pension annual funding notice, Medicare Part D notices, etc)     Work with HRIT and vendor on new vendor integrations and required integration changes     Responsible for working with carriers to help solution and resolve employee and/or dependent claims issues     Respond and resolve internal employee inquiries related to insurance benefit eligibility, claim issues, plan provisions, and enrollment process     In addition to the duties and responsibilities listed, the job holder is required to perform other duties assigned by their manager from time-to-time, as may be reasonably required of them               Skills:           Effectively communicate with key stake holders (employees, managers, HRBPs, COEs, brokers, HRIT, payroll, vendors/insurance carriers, HRIS, etc)     Project Management skills     Critical and analytical skills     Effectively lead in a team environment             Experience:         Prior experience of working with Workday Benefits module     Requires a minimum of 6+ years of Benefits related experience             Education:         Bachelors degree required, masters degree preferred

column2: This role will support our People Operations organization with their increasing need to analyze, model, interpret and report on data for their Human Capital strategies. Progress has a complex business structure which requires the candidate to possess a strong analytical aptitude with exceptional collaboration skills and have very effective prioritization skills and the ability to manage expectations for multiple projects.                 Roles & Responsibility         Partner with the teams within People Operations, provide in-depth analytics to identify actionable insights and opportunities to enhance their ability to support the business.     Authenticates and interprets data based on results using a variety of techniques, ranging from simple data aggregation via statistical analysis to complex data mining.     Provides tactical support by regularly updating dashboards and various models in the Human Capital Analytics function.     Creates and maintains reporting repository across multiple HR functions.     Solicits stakeholder feedback and uses own insights to identify opportunities for improvement among existing reports (i.e., better data quality, enhanced visual presentation, timelier generation, etc.).     Supports continuous data and process quality improvement efforts using key performance indicator (KPI) metrics development and monitoring and the creation of informative data reporting/analysis process documentation.                 Qualifications         Bachelors degree in finance, business, HR, or a related field.     Minimum 5 years of relevant experience in analytics and reporting.     Strong analytical background, including experience with trend analysis, forecasting and experimental design.     Possesses exceptional project management skills with the ability to manage multiple projects from conception to completion.     Exhibit keen attention to detail, prioritize assignments effectively and be flexible to shift priorities as needed, work within tight timeframes, meet deadlines and excellent follow-through.     Very effective at both being a team player and working independently.     Excellent Microsoft skills (Excel, Word, Power Point, Outlook).    Advanced Excel capability.       Experience with Workday and Workday Reporting is a plus.

column2: This role aims at simplifying supply management processes for operations through a lean approach. This is a part of the current workstream on P2P process under the shared responsibility of finance and supply management.     The scope, like the ERP, is global, with a focus for this role on Country / APMEA On-site services.     Root cause analysis and improvements:     An As-Is analysis of the current situation aiming at identifying symptoms and root causes is expected. Root causes and issues can be global, regional, or specific to a country as today processes vary a lot from country to country. The root causes creating most issues will need to be identified using metrics and status shared and agreed.     Once the initial root cause analysis done, recommended actions will need to be drafted, agreed, and implemented measurement of progress is expected using KPIs to be defined. Such activities will need to be embedded into existing projects, initiatives or action plan on system, people, data or processes in order to avoid any siloed work.       Process design       The role will work closely with supply and operations to understand current processes in countries / regions to identify fit gaps, develop an action plan together with the BPO how to transform the way of working and support to implement and train the countries / regions according the global Supply Management processes.     An iterative approach by testing the efficiency of changes is expected to keep improving the recommendations. The approach is lean processes over comprehensive documentation. Also, existing work on P2P processes mapping done as part of the ERP implementation program should be leveraged.     Process implementation and change     Support the communication and activities with countries & global teams.      Conduct alignment workshops and support countries in the formalization of plans.     Train Local Business Process Owners / key users on target processes     Build a network of process experts to embark a maximum of users / countries. Through periodic touch points facilitate and speed-up the sharing and the implementation of best practices.      She / He will also feed the development of identifying gaps in the current IS&T systems along with the Supply Management BPOs.      Review and approve change requests and country localizations.      Enforce the implementation of standard practices where gaps are identified and escalate significant issues to the Group Process Governance Committee        Context and main issues       Supply Management has initiated a transformation which will lead to more automation and simplification. A focus on operational needs and experience is needed which is why a dedicated role has been created.      Collaborate with key stakeholders across country, regional and global function and across departments (finance, supply, IS&T, operations) to understand the situation, requirements and translate them into actionable activities.     Challenge status quo with aim of simplification, standardization aligned with the global processes & leveraging existing investment in P2P processes.     Leverage technology and ERP to address issues and bring significant improvements to the SM function and the operations.       Main assignments       Understanding the future ways of working to enable business change and new system implementation.     Select & on-board a team to lead a short-term study to build a root cause analysis for countries. Leveraging existing inputs from IS&T, supply and finance.      Map root cause, pain points and country specificities \xe2\x80\x93 identify commonalities.     Draft and propose a plan of concrete actions to improve current process on below topics.     Prioritize Gaps and Develop Your Action Plan in alignment with the APMEA BPO.     Communicates project implementation options that affect cost, schedule, quality and risk to stakeholders,      Support the implementation of missing and needed fields in systems.     Catalog creation process implementation to support Better Tomorrow Reporting automation.     Prioritize the workplan per country / region.     Lead the communication and engagement strategy, especially with IS&T and the integrator.     Take a lead role in the UAT testing of any change in systems and ensuring that requirements are met.     continuous update the Business Analyst to keep processes (changes) in ARIS up to date.     When delivering agile projects, produce User Stories if required on behalf of the Product Owner.       Accountabilities       Defines KPIs to monitor progress and track benefits, with regular status updates provided to project stakeholders and executive management team as per the program governance plan.      End to end P2P process improved inc. catalogue and compliance.     Automation of CSR reporting improved       Experience:       Ideally have worked as consultant in Supply Management for 5+ years. ( Food business preferred)     Bachelors degree in engineering with good understanding of computer system.     Experience in lean management and/or six sigmaKnowledge of operational processes.     Strong knowledge of procure to pay process / Catalogue Management     Process driven orientation and experience of working with cross functional teams and global stakeholders.     Experience in supporting change at a senior management level with internal and external stakeholders as well as suppliers.      Project Management experience is a plus.     Fluency in English required.       Skills:       Team Player     Communicator and Negotiator     Planning (workplan, resources) and tracking (indicators, actions)     Problem solving, hands-on.     disciplined and accountable     Verbal Communication     Flexibility to travel       Competencies       Results Oriented     Leadership & People Management     Collaborates     Adaptability & Flexibility     Accountability     Continuous Improvement     Communicates effectively     Results Oriented

column2: Who You Are        We are looking for a team member who considers themselves:          Self-motivated you love to lead others but are also ready to roll up your sleeves." You can spearhead a project and see it through from start to completion.          A team player you navigate cross-functional teams and work well with team members across groups toward a common goal. While you are an independent contributor, you appreciate the value in collaboration.          An innovator you see gaps in current processes or workflows as an opportunity to improve and try something new.          A lifelong learner you seek opportunities to learn and upskill, you understand the importance of thorough and secure screenings, and are interested in the Human Capital sector and the confluence of people, process, and technology.            What Youll Do        A successful Senior HRIS Analyst will support the team and organization in driving and communicating the HRIS roadmap, enable transformative change and migration as we transition to using Workday as our source of truth for all employees, work collaboratively with HR teams and business partners; evaluate, design, configure, test, document, and implement HRIS functionality; provide troubleshooting support as well as training, including developing user procedures, guidelines, and documentation; and analyze, audit and maintain HRIS Systems, including but not limited to Workday. This position will serve as a technical point of contact for all functional areas and will ensure data integrity, system changes, testing, develop reports and analyze data flows for process improvement, providing technical expertise in the utilization, development, and implementation of technology related projects.      Note on location: this role is remote.       Responsibilities:            Collaboratively define, enable, and execute on the measurable HR technology strategy and roadmap, ensuring alignment with business needs and objectives as well as compliance          Maximize improvements, usability and automation by analyzing current practices, recommending solutions, and designing and implementing modifications          Lead requirements-gathering, roadmap, configuration setup and ongoing management for new, third-party integrations and technologies          Partner with HR leaders and external vendors to identify opportunities to optimize HR technology solutions and processes          Partner with Business Leaders to gather feedback and requirements needed to configure and maintain Workday systems to meet achieve business results          Support end-to-end release management, and stay updated with Workday releases and new features to identify opportunities          Collaborate with other team members to troubleshoot and resolve issues related to Workday implementation projects              Support administration of Workday Security Framework and ITGC and SOX controls for the effectiveness of the system and process operation          Develop and maintain reports, resources, training materials, and documentation on Workday system configurations and processes as applicable            What You May Need to be Successful            5+ years of hands-on experience in Workday and HCM architecture and analytics          4+ years of experience driving HCM migration in a global, public organization          Demonstrated success in setting and accomplishing cross-functional roadmaps

column2: Job Summary:  As the HR Analyst for Global Onboarding and Off-boarding, you will play a crucial role in ensuring a  seamless and efficient transition for new hires entering the organization and departing employees  leaving the company on a global scale. You will be responsible for executing comprehensive on-boarding and off-boarding processes that align with the organization's goals and values. Efficiently  handling Tier I and Tier II queries related to employee demographic updates/changes.  Responsibilities:  Global Onboarding:  ??Implement a standardized global onboarding program for new employees, ensuring a  consistent and positive experience across different regions.  ??Collaborate with various departments to develop onboarding materials, including welcome  kits, training manuals, and orientation sessions.  ??Collaborate with various departments to ensure timely issuing of assets, inclusion of  employee profile in our systems and other required facilities are enabled.  ??Coordinate with local HR teams to customize onboarding processes based on regional  requirements and cultural nuances.  ??Facilitate new hire orientations, providing information on company policies, values, and  expectations.  ??Monitor the progress of new hires during the onboarding period and address any issues or  concerns promptly.  Global Off-boarding:  ??Maintain a standardized off-boarding process to ensure a smooth transition for departing  employees.  ??Collaborate with HR, IT, and relevant departments to gather necessary inputs for final  payroll clearance.  ??Conduct exit interviews to gather valuable feedback and identify areas for improvement in  the off-boarding process.  ??Prepare off-boarding documentation, ensuring compliance with company policies and legal  requirements.  ??Provide support to departing employees, addressing any concerns and ensuring a positive  last impression of the organization. Query Handling:  ??Additionally, manage Tier I and Tier II queries related to employee demographic changes,  ensuring accurate and timely resolution.  ??Requires strong co-ordination with several related teams and departments to ensure  update of the data in our ERPs. Requirements:  ??Bachelor's degree in any field.  ??Minimum 4 to 6 years of proven experience in HR related responsibilities.  ??Excellent communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to interact effectively with  employees at all levels.  ??Basic reporting knowledge.  ??Ready to work in flexible shifts and work from the Office 5 days a week.  ??Familiarity with any ticketing tool like ServiceNow, Siebel etc.

column2: You have experience in . Resource Management / Workforce Management / Staffing / Bench Management and should have worked in project staffing, handling escalations, Allocation, Fulfilment, Utilization etc..      You are good at Excel and analytical skills in addition to Good and effective communication skills      You have built Dashboards, Reports, and Effective Presentations in last 3-5 Yrs of your experience      Should have experience working with US team and understand the concepts of resource management      This individual will have to extend work timings upto 10PM IST when required and so on.          What you will enjoy in this role          As part of the Epsilon Resource Management team, the pace of the work matches the fast-evolving demands of the requirement in EI and US      As part of an innovative team that s not afraid to take risks, your ideas will come to life to support fulfil requirements in EI and US      As a key technical decision maker, you will provide direction and mentorship to your team, even as you define Resource Management best practices          What you will do          ROLES AND RESPONSIBILITIES          Accurately capture & maintain project needs and updates in the data repositories/tools.      Generate daily/weekly reports highlighting resourcing needs and options to fill open roles.      Drive adoption of central Resource Management processes and tools.      Be the champion and promoter of consistent Resource Management practices across groups.      Help identify gaps in the current resource management practices and come up with scalable solutions.      Ability to communicate effectively with senior stakeholders and market leads to understand project objectives and resourcing needs clearly & completely.      Collaborate with account deliver leads (ADL) to close the roles and maintain the system.      Be able to clearly communicate and articulate, both written and verbally, detailed steps taken for any problem remediation or task completed.          A full time MBA with 7-9 Yrs experience worked in RM role      Worked Extensively in RM function for a minimum 7 Yrs
column11: Analytical skills, remediation, Workforce management, Excel, Staffing, Senior Analyst, Resourcing, bench management, Resource management

column2: PFB JD for WORKDAY PAYROLL Exp: 4 to 8 Yrs Work From Home  Work Time: 3 PM to 12 AM Contract Duration: 3 to 6 Months(COntract) Notice Period: Immediate We are seeking an experienced and detail-oriented Senior Workday Tester with a strong background in North America (NA) Payroll and Benefits to join our team ContinuServe. The ideal candidate should have 4 to 8 years of hands-on experience in testing Workday modules, specifically focusing on Payroll and Benefits functionalities. Requirements:  4 to 8 years of proven experience as a Workday Tester, with a focus on NA Payroll and Benefits. In-depth knowledge of Workday Payroll and Benefits modules. Strong understanding of testing methodologies and best practices. Ability to lead testing efforts and provide guidance to team members. Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills. Key Skills: Required Professional Expertise in Workday Payroll for US including Payroll Processing Framework, Period Schedule structure, Payment elections rules, Paygroups, Earnings & Deductions, Pay Slips, Pay component groups, Compensation elements, Tax withholding and Payroll Input processing. Required professional expertise in Workday Benefits including Benefit groups, Benefit plans, Events, Business process, Enrolment Events and Rules , Automatic Benefit Eligibility Checks, Benefit Costs & Rates, Default Coverage & Auto-Enrolment, Dependents & Beneficiaries. Preferred Professional Expertise in Core HCM which includes Job recruiting, Absence management, Time, and Attendance, Tracking talents and Business process related from Hire to Termination cycle. Worked closely with Business and Development Teams to understand requirements on preparing the Test cases, Performing Test Execution and Reporting the defects. Strong understanding of testing methodologies and best practices. Excellent Interpersonal, Presentation and Communication Skills with the ability to lead the team and work in a Stand-alone Environment. we can look for tester or functional. Location : - Remote
column11: Payroll, Benefits, payroll processing, test cases, business development, test execution, test methodologies, taxation

column1: Dy. Manager HR Plant , wd MNC in Bhiwadi Rajasthan
column2: Hi, one of our leading MNC Clients in manufacturing looking for an Deputy Manager -HR Plant position based in Alwar, Rajasthan. Roles and Responsibilities :- Job Purpose: Harmonious HR and IR operations at a unit level through effective engagement. Time Office Management:  Maintaining proper attendance system, updating daily attendance and leave records to have control over absenteeism  Maintaining shift schedules of all the associates and ensuing proper compliance of the same.  Compilation of Overtime details on daily basis & reviewing the same to have control on costs  Payroll management: Ensure payroll inputs to be prepared and run as per the timeframe.  Performance Appraisals Ensuring annual appraisals on time Ensuring Goal setting process is done on time Statutory Compliance Timely adherence and compliance with various labour laws and other statutes applicable to the factory in the state and at a central level. Zero incident count on compliance-violation. Liaison with labour office, factory inspector, PF department, labour welfare board, Panchayats, Municipality, police and other statutory institutions and bodies. Contract labour management:  Ensure the deployment of contract labour as per approved manning.  Ensure contract labour cost within budget, daily review of CL deployment to ensure the costs within budget.  Ensure the  productivity of CL as per standards,          Ensure  all statutory compliances with regard to deployment of CL viz maintenance of all registers by principle employer as well contractor, filed all returns etc.   Industrial Relations: Monthly meetings with employee representatives to understand and identify issues if any to have harmonious industrial relations at the plan Grievance resolution Long term wage settlements to be productivity linked and within the specified PC budget. Enter into agreements and negotiate on labour contracts, canteen and housekeeping contracts, ETP contract, etc. Training and development:  Assist all departments HR in implementing the training calendar.   All records relating training are properly maintained. MIS & Reporting:  Analysis and preparation of data with respect to productivity and costs  are prepared on daily basis   Preparation of daily report to ensure effective tracking of CL.  Preparing presentations for review every month to ensure effective achievement of targets  To ensure any other related duties assigned by the superior Experience:   6 -10 Year ,,having experience from manufacturing industry , Plant Generalist HR  Qualification:   MBA  HR / MSW - Full Time Working experience on SAP set up preferred. Kindly share your updated CV in word format, my mail ID - vagish@ecatapult.net Regards, Vagish.
column11: Compliance, Time Office, Compliance Management, hr, Statutory Compliance, Payroll, employee engagement, human resource management, attendance system, contract labour

column2: Artech India is looking for Executive - Human Resource to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey        An Executive in Human Resources (HR) is a professional who plays a critical role in managing and overseeing various HR functions within an organization      They are responsible for implementing HR policies, procedures, and initiatives that support the organization's goals and objectives      Here are the key responsibilities and qualifications associated with the role of an Executive in Human Resources:        Responsibilities:        Recruitment and Talent Acquisition: Coordinate and manage the recruitment and selection process, including job postings, resume screening, interviewing, and candidate evaluation      Collaborate with hiring managers to identify staffing needs and ensure the timely acquisition of qualified candidates      Employee Onboarding and Offboarding: Facilitate the onboarding process for new hires, including conducting orientation sessions, explaining company policies, and ensuring a smooth transition into the organization      Manage offboarding activities, such as exit interviews and separation procedures, to ensure a positive and professional experience for departing employees      Performance Management: Assist in the implementation and administration of performance management programs      Support managers in conducting performance evaluations, setting goals, and providing feedback to employees      Collaborate with managers to address performance issues and develop improvement plans      Employee Relations: Handle employee relations matters by providing guidance, counseling, and conflict resolution support      Investigate and address employee grievances, complaints, and disciplinary issues in accordance with company policies and applicable employment laws      Compensation and Benefits Administration: Assist in the administration of compensation and benefits programs, including salary reviews, bonus programs, and employee benefits enrollment      Collaborate with payroll and finance departments to ensure accurate and timely processing of employee compensation and benefits
column11: interviewing, screening, orientation, exit interviews, employee relations, employee grievances, hiring, hr policies, hr functions, hrsd, selection process, job posting, staffing, talent acquisition, recruitment, screening resumes, onboarding, compensation, payroll

column2: CYGNUS INSTITUTE OF GASTROENTEROLOGY HOSPITAL is looking for HR Executive to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey      Identifying manpower requirements, taking them up to the HR Head for approval      Creating job descriptions for required manpower, advertising them to get best candidates and handling the employment process      Creating and managing schedules, meetings, interviews, and other HR activities      Reviewing CVs, shortlisting candidates and assisting in the recruitment process      Liasioning with external recruitment agencies for closing positions on time      Handling the orientation of new employees      Conducting training sessions for old and new employees of the organization      Ensuring that the employees are satisfied with their role in the organisation, the work environment      Handling performance management procedure and appraisals is a key task in hr executive job description.      Maintaining records, attendance and data of each employee and providing them to the management team when required      Conducting exit interviews with outgoing employees.      Handling employee grievances, if any and updating the employees with policies, compliances, and regulations      Overseeing safety and health of the employees      Handling the orientation of new employees is one of the key points that should be included in all hr executive job description      Conducting SWAT analysis of each employee and counselling them on the areas that need improvement      Handling and managing data/records of each employee of the organization.

column2: We are seeking a dynamic and experienced HR Professional to join our team. The ideal candidate will have a minimum of 2 years of experience in human resources, with a strong focus on communication skills and a passion for fostering positive employee relations. Responsibilities: Employee Relations:  Act as a liaison between employees and management to resolve conflicts, address grievances, and foster a positive work environment. Recruitment and Onboarding:  Manage the end-to-end recruitment process, including job postings, screening resumes, conducting interviews, and facilitating new employee onboarding. Performance Management:  Implement and manage performance evaluation processes, provide coaching and feedback to employees, and assist in developing performance improvement plans when necessary. Training and Development:  Identify training needs within the organization, coordinate training sessions, and support employee development initiatives. HR Policies and Compliance:  Ensure compliance with all relevant employment laws and regulations, update HR policies and procedures as needed, and provide guidance to employees and management on HR-related matters. Benefits Administration:  Administer employee benefits programs, including health insurance, retirement plans, and other employee perks. HR Data Management:  Maintain accurate employee records, generate reports as needed, and utilize HRIS systems to streamline HR processes. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or related field. Minimum of 2 years of experience in human resources. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. Strong organizational skills with the ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks. Knowledge of employment laws and regulations. Proficiency in HRIS systems and Microsoft Office Suite. HR certification (e.g., SHRM-CP, PHR) is a plus.   In addition, we offer you: An atmosphere in which you let your ideas run wild and in which you and your skills can unfold and develop New tasks and challenges every day that you can solve independently and creatively The possibility to stimulate improvements anytime and anywhere and, in the best case, to carry them out Flexible working hours, and more.
column11: Communication Skills, Microsoft Applications, Adaptability, Organization Skills, Interpersonal Skills

column2: Job Description Danfoss is looking for HR Executive.   Roles & Responsibilities Be   the first point of contact for all HR related inquiries. Address   employee inquiries with the help of knowledge management documentation   available while ensuring to create "wow" experience for employees. Be   customer oriented, and try to resolve queries without unnecessary holding   time or escalations. Be   caring in the approach, be sensitive to all types of requests from employees. Work   with relevant HR partners, country point of contacts to get answers as   required to help our employees. Ensure   that our KM documentation (hub facing) is always up-to-date; update relevant   internal KM documents (example - FAQs, troubleshooting guides) as and when   required, based on changes. Ensure   to meet the set KPIs and a consistent high employee experience creation score Escalate   to relevant COEs on any KM documentation gaps. Provide   support to employees via various channels based on requirement : Phone, Chat   and service ticket.   Competencies Customer   centricity. Written   communication. Verbal   communication. Active   listening. Positive   display of motivation (attitude). Attention   to detail Time   management Teamwork Effective   execution Cultural   awareness & sensitivity Empathy:   Show understanding and compassion toward employee needs. Problem-Solving:   Resolve issues promptly and efficiently. Basic   HR Practices: Basic understanding of HR practices, policies and procedures Self-Service   Tools: Familiarity with HRIS and self-service portals. Accuracy:   Ensure precise data entry and documentation. Compliance:   Adhere to rules and regulations. Prioritize   Tasks: Handle multiple inquiries while meeting deadlines. Confidentiality:   Maintain employee privacy. Positive   Attitude: Create a welcoming experience for employees.
column11: Customer Service, Hr Support, Hr Shared Services, KPI Management, HR Ticket Management, HRIS

column2: Skill required:  Talent & HR Practice - Talent Management Designation:  Analytics and Modeling New Associate Qualifications: Any Graduation  Years of Experience: 0 to 1 years  Language - Ability: English - Intermediate  What would you do? Improve workforce performance and productivity, boosts business agility, increases revenue and reduces costsThis role provides client services for Comp & Benefits to ensure tasks are completed correctly and resource efficiencies are maintained, works closely with Delivery Service Management to identify and escalate client issues; obtains and confirms pending information / documentation, and adds and amends transaction information to client/systems responding to changes (via e-mail / telephone) so as to maintain a current visible HR records for the client. Candidates with HRBP experience, Read, understand and analyze client process as per the business rules.  Execute full range of the process accurately and timely as a hands on processor. Escalate issues and seek advice when faced with complex issues/problems.  Follow Work Instructions while processing Highlight any anomalies in Work Instructions/process documentation to the SME/Leads.  Participate in client conference calls, where required and manage appropriate documentation. Perform Root Cause Analysis on issues faces and suggest appropriate corrective action for current remediation and future control. In Talent Management you will need to support workforce behavior in alignment with the organization`s business strategy by designing, developing, implementing, and executing key HR processes:strategic planning; supply demand; hiring and sourcing; on-boarding and integration; training and development; objective-setting and performance management; and compensation and rewards. What are we looking for? Must be able to propose process improvement ideas which can reduce time, improved accuracy or enhance controls  Must have clear understanding of the existing matrices in the process, how they are measured and improvise the measurement system to make it more effective and transparent.  Update process metrics on daily basis and maintain MIS. Always demonstrate the highest level of customer service. Pay close attention to detail and follow through to resolve any outstanding issues. Goes beyond immediate requests and activities to ensure both own and related tasks are completed. Update client applications accurately and quickly in accordance with the appropriate User Guides. Ensure assigned tasks are completed accurately in timely fashion. Ensure and maintain the security and confidentiality of client data. Activley Participate in team activities & Organizational initiatives Knowledge of Comp & Benefits and Performance management Processes.  Strong command on written and verbal English language Knowledge of MS Office/Excel Skills would be a plus Knowledge of SuccessFactors would be a plus  Roles and Responsibilities: In this role you are required to solve routine problems, largely through precedent and referral to general guidelines Your primary interaction is within your own team and your direct supervisor In this role you will be given detailed instructions on all tasks The decisions that you make impact your own work and are closely supervised You will be an individual contributor as a part of a team with a predetermined, narrow scope of work Please note that this role may require you to work in rotational shifts Qualification Any Graduation

column1: HR Analyst/HR MIS Executive - Advance Excel and Formulas
column2: As an HR MIS (Management Information Systems) Executive, your role involves managing and analyzing HR-related data to support decision-making processes within the HR department and the organization as a whole. Here's how your proficiency in Advanced Excel and formulas would be applied in this context: Data Management and Analysis: Organizing and managing HR data such as employee information, attendance records, payroll data, performance evaluations, and training records in Excel spreadsheets. Utilizing functions like VLOOKUP, INDEX-MATCH, and SUMIFS to retrieve and summarize HR data based on specific criteria. Analyzing turnover rates, employee demographics, and other key HR metrics using PivotTables and PivotCharts. Reporting and Dashboard Creation: Generating HR reports such as headcount reports, turnover analysis, recruitment metrics, and performance appraisal summaries. Creating dynamic dashboards to provide HR managers and stakeholders with real-time insights into key HR metrics and trends. Using advanced charting techniques and visualization tools to present HR data effectively, including histograms, heatmaps, and waterfall charts. Performance Management: Developing Excel-based tools for performance management processes, including performance evaluation templates, goal tracking sheets, and competency assessment matrices. Implementing formulas and conditional formatting to calculate and visualize performance ratings, performance scores, and competency levels. Recruitment and Talent Acquisition: Tracking recruitment activities, such as job openings, applicants, interview schedules, and hiring statuses, using Excel spreadsheets. Building candidate pipelines and analyzing recruitment metrics such as time-to-fill, cost-per-hire, and source effectiveness. Creating automated workflows and email alerts using Excel macros or VBA to streamline recruitment processes. Training and Development: Managing training schedules, training attendance, and training evaluation data in Excel. Tracking employee skill levels, training needs, and certification expirations using Excel-based systems. Analyzing training effectiveness and return on investment (ROI) using Excel formulas and data visualization techniques. Compliance and Reporting: Ensuring compliance with HR regulations and internal policies by tracking HR-related data and generating compliance reports as needed. Creating audit trails and documentation using Excel features like data validation, cell protection, and workbook tracking. Generating statutory reports for government agencies or regulatory bodies, such as EEOC reports or payroll tax filings. Data Security and Confidentiality: Implementing data security measures to protect sensitive HR information stored in Excel files, including password protection, encryption, and restricted access controls. Ensuring compliance with data privacy regulations such as GDPR or HIPAA when handling employee data in Excel. Data Visualization: Creating visually appealing and informative HR dashboards using Excel's charting capabilities and visualization tools. Incorporating interactive elements like slicers, timelines, and form controls to enhance user interactivity. Employing conditional formatting to highlight important trends, outliers, or exceptions in HR data. Data Cleaning and Transformation: Cleaning and standardizing HR data using Excel's data cleaning tools and functions (e.g., Text to Columns, TRIM, PROPER). Transforming raw HR data into structured formats suitable for reporting and analysis. Dealing with data inconsistencies, missing values, and duplicates to ensure data accuracy and integrity. In addition to Advanced Excel skills, proficiency in HRIS (Human Resources Information Systems) software and familiarity with HR analytics tools can further enhance your effectiveness as an HR MIS Executive. Keeping abreast of HR best practices, industry trends, and regulatory changes is also essential for success in this role. Skillsets and Education : 1. Graduation is mandatory 2. VLOOKUP, HLOOKUP, SUMIFS, COUNTIFS, HR REPORTS.
column11: Advanced Excel, Data Validation, Countif, MIS Operations, Conditional Formatting, Formulas, Power Point Presentation, MIS Reporting, Macros, Pivot Table, SUMIF, VLOOKUP, Dashboards

column2: Your Role and Responsibilities As a Senior Service Associate -Recruitment you are responsible  for  working with partners and providing customer happiness with RPO services. You will work closely with the client, IBM's operation management, and staff. You will define, develop, plan and implement sourcing strategies to provide a qualified talent pool. If you thrive in a dynamic, collaborative workplace, IBM provides an environment where you will be challenged and inspired every single day. And if you relish the freedom to bring creative, thoughtful solutions to the table, there's no limit to what you can accomplish here.  As Lead Recruiter, you are responsible for  Responsibilities : Engage stakholders to define, build and document hiring forecasts Work with hiring manager to set Service Level Agreements (SLA) expectations and requirements  Work within pre-defined recruitment processes while assessing that process to identify, recommend areas, improve and build standard methodologies to follow Provide new methods with the approach for sourcing candidates and generating new leads Meet weekly/monthly/quarterly production goals  Work in conjunction with the business head in the establishment of weekly/quarterly/yearly Global Delivery Center goals Review, analyze, mentor and coach support teams to ensure recruiting goals are being met through a reciprocal approach Utilize ATS to perform candidate screening (and other program tools) Ensure detailed screening and selection criteria to identify top talent and resolve meaningful strength of the talent in the pool Participate in client meetings at the direction of the Operations Director and/or Client Relationship Director to construct everlasting work relations that shall enhance strong customer satisfaction Update status of Candidates on Applicant Tracking System (ATS) regularly Perform other miscellaneous duties as required by management Required Technical and Professional Expertise Minimum 3 plus years of experience in recruitment standard methodologies (preferably in ITES BPO FA) Experience in building rapport and collaborating with Hiring Managers through the open requisition, sourcing, debrief and offer stages Expertise in sourcing through social media channels and other innovative sourcing channels Demonstrable experience in partner management and strength to hold difficult conversations with them Build expertise in deep domain knowledge, understanding of business strategy and drive innovation  Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise Experience in direct sourcing and recruitment experience in a corporate or consultancy (RPO set up is preferred) Equipped with consultative instinct, passionate about recruiting and not view the role as transactional Proficiency and experience in Applicant Tracking Systems (ATS) and Human Resources Information Systems (HRIS) will be an advantage Ambitious individual who can work under their own direction towards agreed targets/goals  Proven change management and be open to it good time management and work under tight deadlines  Demonstrated interpersonal skills while contributing to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed Maintain technical knowledge by attending educational workshops, reviewing publications

column2: Skill required:  payroll - Payroll Planning and Distribution Designation:  Analyst Qualifications: Any Graduation  Years of Experience: 3-5 Yrs  What would you do? You will be aligned to our Human Resources vertical and will help us in the function that deals with people and people related areas such as recruiting, learning, training, onboarding, compensation and benefits, performance management, organization development and culture. You will be working as a part of HR Operations team which is responsible for providing backend HR services to business operations. HR operations and operational HR services, include administrative services, job analysis, and employee relationship management. The Payroll Planning and Distribution team focuses on distributing employees' pay on time through chosen channels such as banks and execute the distribution of earnings statements either manually or electronically. The team is responsible for addressing queries related to provident fund, new joinee/existing employee mediclaim policies, monthly group payroll reconciliation and for updating monthly resignation, retirement and contract closures. The team is also responsible for resolving payroll problems within the confines of established policies & procedures using relevant payroll system. What are we looking for? HR Analytics  HR Delivery Strategy  HR Operations  HR Policy Development & Maintenance  Prioritization of workload  Written and verbal communication  Numerical ability  CL 11Minimum 2-4 years of experience/knowledge in Payroll for any country i.e., US, UK, Europe, India, etc. Knowledge of any ERP application including Workday would be plus (i.e., SAP, PeopleSoft)  Compensation Administration Process Design  Roles and Responsibilities: In this role you are required to do analysis and solving of lower-complexity problems  Your day to day interaction is with peers within Accenture before updating supervisors  In this role you may have limited exposure with clients and/or Accenture management  You will be given moderate level instruction on daily work tasks and detailed instructions on new assignments  The decisions you make impact your own work and may impact the work of others  You will be an individual contributor as a part of a team, with a focused scope of work  Please note that this role may require you to work in rotational shifts Qualification Any Graduation

column2: Ensure that new joiner is given adequate training on the internal tools like HRMS,Paysquare and Time entry. Ensure that employee is notified on the insurance, PF, gratuity, Sodexo etc.      Ensure that new joiner induction is organized with all the new hires.      Probation Confirmation:      Liaising with the business to initiate the confirmation process for those who have completed the probation.      Ensure proper transition during confirmation/extension to manager as well as employee.      Ensure that Trainee progress reports are up to date and escalate it to the management if there are any deviations.      Performance Management System:      Own the Performance Management System of Kensium      Educating the employees on the process and procedure of the appraisal.      Conducting the hygiene check on the rating provided and escalate it to next level for further actions.      Consolidate and share the managers recommendations and inputs in Bonus and Increments sheet for review.      Issuance of letters to the employees who are eligible for bonus and increments      Payroll Management:      Should have good knowledge on the various pay structures, and components considered for payroll.      Should have fair knowledge on payroll management, consolidate and share payroll inputs to the respective stake holders for processing the payroll on time.      Ensure that the Verify the payroll inputs on time and submit the required details to KAFS and Paysquare team.

column2: EY- Assurance  Staff  Experience Management As part of our EY-Assurance Team, you will be working to ensure effective resource scheduling on scheduling tools, considering resource management guidelines, processes and protocols.? The opportunity Were looking for candidates with knowledge and capability in terms of managing resources / manpower using different resource management and deployment tools within EY GDS Assurance. Your key responsibilities Timely updation of resource schedules on scheduling tools (ARMS/Retain) Timely review and resolution of scheduling conflicts. Proactive review of resource availability /resource requirements. Mailbox management and fulfilling the scheduling requests coming through mails in defined TAT. Optimization of resource utilization through effective schedule management. Basic reporting and analysis. Skills and attributes for success Good verbal and written communication skills. Basic knowledge of MS Excel. Excellent teaming and interpersonal skills. Positive attitude and ability to excel under tight timelines. To qualify for the role, you must have Graduates with 0-3 years of relevant resource management/workforce management / exposure in General Operations with strong acumen in resource management preferred. Ideally, youll also have Basis knowledge on MS  Excel Ms - Office Interest in business and commerciality. What we look for A Team of people with commercial acumen, technical experience and enthusiasm to learn new things in this fast-moving environment An opportunity to be part of a market-leading, multi-disciplinary team in the only integrated global assurance business worldwide. Opportunity to work with EY GDS Assurance practices globally with leading businesses across a range of industries

column2: About the role: He/She will be part of the Regional HR Leadership team and work with the EKART HR Leaders to define & execute the HR strategy. Manage relations with internal customers, partnering with them in building a robust People charter and scale up the organization as per business requirements. Be the leader with HR subject matter expertise & align HR best practices to business needs and employees. You are responsible for: Align business practice with people to drive effective performance. Identify, analyse, scale and implement best practices suited for the organization through effective HR. Managing the entire employee's life cycle. Accountable for managing the mid-level recruitment function for City Logistics operations from search, selection, assessment and on boarding activities. Develop effective partnership with employees, managers and ensure a positive work environment. Create a robust employee network. Be an active mentor and coach for Junior and mid management on people and business practices. Coach Hub leaders and managers on people management and HR challenges Work towards enhancing business performance through efficient business partnering. Look for ways to proactively improve & enhance processes. Be the guardian of change management - for changes that have any people implications. Evaluate potential employee challenges and address proactively to enhance employee satisfaction. Develop and nurture professional relationships with peers, colleagues, business and senior leaders and build effective employee engagement strategies. Create effective analytical tools & reports to analyze employee information. Enable managers & leaders with proactive solutions to address people challenges and foster positive work environment Identify HR intervention needs, create appropriate programs, actively participate in HR interventions & projects and ensure timely completion. Manage available resources effectively and promote HR capabilities. Collaborate effectively with all stakeholders within HR organization What you should have Strong Leadership Abilities Passion to lead a successful and challenging work environment Strong Bias for Impact Based Action - Flipkart works at a very rapid pace and this is what would be expected. To succeed in this role you should have the following 1 to 3 yrs of experience in regional HRBP role Candidates from Ecommerce, FMCG, FMCD & retail sector are preferred. Should have experience in managing FTE/ FTC employees. Good in handling IR Issues, compliance etc. Skills Required: HR Generalist Activities, Change Management, Stakeholder Management, selection, employee relations Education/Qualification: MBA
