column2: Skill required:  Talent & HR Practice - Talent Management Designation:  Analytics and Modeling Associate Qualifications: Any Graduation  Years of Experience: 1 to 3 years  Language - Ability: English - Intermediate  What would you do? Improve workforce performance and productivity, boosts business agility, increases revenue and reduces costsThis role provides client services for Comp & Benefits to ensure tasks are completed correctly and resource efficiencies are maintained, works closely with Delivery Service Management to identify and escalate client issues; obtains and confirms pending information / documentation, and adds and amends transaction information to client/systems responding to changes (via e-mail / telephone) so as to maintain a current visible HR records for the client. Candidates with HRBP experience, Read, understand and analyze client process as per the business rules.  Execute full range of the process accurately and timely as a hands on processor. Escalate issues and seek advice when faced with complex issues/problems.  Follow Work Instructions while processing Highlight any anomalies in Work Instructions/process documentation to the SME/Leads.  Participate in client conference calls, where required and manage appropriate documentation. Perform Root Cause Analysis on issues faces and suggest appropriate corrective action for current remediation and future control. In Talent Management you will need to support workforce behavior in alignment with the organization`s business strategy by designing, developing, implementing, and executing key HR processes:strategic planning; supply demand; hiring and sourcing; on-boarding and integration; training and development; objective-setting and performance management; and compensation and rewards. What are we looking for? Must be able to propose process improvement ideas which can reduce time, improved accuracy or enhance controls  Must have clear understanding of the existing matrices in the process, how they are measured and improvise the measurement system to make it more effective and transparent.  Update process metrics on daily basis and maintain MIS. Always demonstrate the highest level of customer service. Pay close attention to detail and follow through to resolve any outstanding issues. Goes beyond immediate requests and activities to ensure both own and related tasks are completed. Update client applications accurately and quickly in accordance with the appropriate User Guides. Ensure assigned tasks are completed accurately in timely fashion. Ensure and maintain the security and confidentiality of client data. column2: A career within Workday Consulting services, will provide you with the opportunity to help our clients leverage Workday technology as a tool to enhance and unify Human Resources, talent management, and finance     We focus on understanding the forces shaping their business and developing industry tailored solutions that support our clients through the entire lifecycle of the Workday implementation                 Certification:    Workday Certified       We are seeking a highly skilled and certified Workday HR Functional Consultant with extensive experience in Workday implementations and a specialization in either the Talend, Absence, or Time Tracking module     The ideal candidate will play a pivotal role in optimizing our HR   processes and systems using Workday         Key Responsibilities:         - Workday Implementation:    Lead and actively participate in Workday implementations, including configuration, testing, and deployment, ensuring successful delivery within project timelines.       - Functional Expertise:    Leverage in-depth knowledge of Workday modules, specializing in either Talend, Absence, or Time Tracking, to provide expert guidance to clients.       - Client Collaboration:    Collaborate closely with clients to understand their HR requirements, translate them into Workday solutions, and provide consultation on best practices.     -    Configuration and Customization:    Configure Workday to align with client-specific HR processes, including custom reports, workflows, and integrations.     -    Testing and Quality Assurance   : Conduct thorough testing of Workday configurations and integrations, ensuring data accuracy and system functionality.     -    Documentation   : Create and maintain detailed documentation of Workday configurations, business processes, and solutions.       - Training and Support:    Provide training to end-users and assist in the resolution of HR system-related issues.       - Stay Updated:    Stay informed about Workday updates, enhancements, and industry best practices, and apply this knowledge to improve system functionality.       Qualifications:     - Bachelors degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or related field.   - Workday Certification is required.   - 4-6 years of relevant experience as a Workday HR Functional Consultant.   - Specialization in one or more of the following Workday modules: Talend, Absence, or Time Tracking.   - Proven experience in Workday implementations, including configuration and testing.   - Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.         - Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to collaborate effectively with clients and team members.   - Ability to work independently and manage multiple projects simultaneously.   - Strong documentation and reporting skills.               Mandatory Skill Set: workday      Qualifications: B.E/MBA
column11: Business administration, Interpersonal skills, HR processes, Manager Quality Assurance, Analytical, Consulting, Manager Technology, HR, Talent management, Implementation Lead

column2: Your Role and Responsibilities As a Senior Service Associate -Recruitment you are responsible  for  working with partners and providing customer happiness with RPO services. You will work closely with the client, IBM's operation management, and staff. You will define, develop, plan and implement sourcing strategies to provide a qualified talent pool. If you thrive in a dynamic, collaborative workplace, IBM provides an environment where you will be challenged and inspired every single day. And if you relish the freedom to bring creative, thoughtful solutions to the table, there's no limit to what you can accomplish here.  As Lead Recruiter, you are responsible for  Responsibilities : Engage stakholders to define, build and document hiring forecasts Work with hiring manager to set Service Level Agreements (SLA) expectations and requirements  Work within pre-defined recruitment processes while assessing that process to identify, recommend areas, improve and build standard methodologies to follow Provide new methods with the approach for sourcing candidates and generating new leads Meet weekly/monthly/quarterly production goals  Work in conjunction with the business head in the establishment of weekly/quarterly/yearly Global Delivery Center goals Review, analyze, mentor and coach support teams to ensure recruiting goals are being met through a reciprocal approach Utilize ATS to perform candidate screening (and other program tools) Ensure detailed screening and selection criteria to identify top talent and resolve meaningful strength of the talent in the pool Participate in client meetings at the direction of the Operations Director and/or Client Relationship Director to construct everlasting work relations that shall enhance strong customer satisfaction Update status of Candidates on Applicant Tracking System (ATS) regularly Perform other miscellaneous duties as required by management Required Technical and Professional Expertise Minimum 3 plus years of experience in recruitment standard methodologies (preferably in ITES BPO FA) Experience in building rapport and collaborating with Hiring Managers through the open requisition, sourcing, debrief and offer stages Expertise in sourcing through social media channels and other innovative sourcing channels Demonstrable experience in partner management and strength to hold difficult conversations with them Build expertise in deep domain knowledge, understanding of business strategy and drive innovation  Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise Experience in direct sourcing and recruitment experience in a corporate or consultancy (RPO set up is preferred) Equipped with consultative instinct, passionate about recruiting and not view the role as transactional Proficiency and experience in Applicant Tracking Systems (ATS) and Human Resources Information Systems (HRIS) will be an advantage Ambitious individual who can work under their own direction towards agreed targets/goals  Proven change management and be open to it good time management and work under tight deadlines  Demonstrated interpersonal skills while contributing to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed Maintain technical knowledge by attending educational workshops, reviewing publications
column11: ats, hris, sourcing, recruitment, applicant tracking system, employee relations, production, human resource management software, business strategy, training, change management, hr operations, rpo, talent acquisition, employee engagement, performance management

column2: We are seeking a highly skilled and detail-oriented individual to join our team as an HRIS Specialist. In this role, you will play a crucial part in enhancing our Human Resources Information System (HRIS) by developing comprehensive and user-friendly reports, ensuring the accuracy of data, and fortifying the security and confidentiality of HR data. The ideal candidate will possess a strong background in HRIS, reporting, data accuracy, and security, along with excellent communication and analytical skills.               The role:                 Collaborate with HR and other stakeholders to understand reporting requirements.             Design and develop custom reports using HRIS tools to meet the needs of various departments.             Ensure the accuracy, relevance, and timeliness of reports to support informed decision-making.             Implement data quality checks to ensure the accuracy and integrity of HRIS data.             Collaborate with HR, IT and Operations teams to identify and resolve data discrepancies and inconsistencies.             Develop and implement procedures for ongoing data validation and correction.             Implement and maintain security measures to protect HRIS data from unauthorized access and ensure compliance with data protection regulations.             Create and maintain comprehensive documentation for all HRIS reporting processes, ensuring clarity and ease of understanding for end-users.             Provide training sessions for HR and other relevant teams on utilizing HRIS reports effectively, securely, and accurately.             Offer support and troubleshooting assistance to users encountering issues with HRIS reporting, data accuracy, or security.             Serve as main point of contact to employees to troubleshoot user experience issues             Collaborate with HR, IT, and other departments to understand evolving business needs and ensure that HRIS reporting aligns with organizational goals.                     You have:                 Bachelors degree in human resources, Information Technology, or a related field.       Proven experience in HRIS reporting, data accuracy with a minimum of 4 years in a similar role.     In-depth knowledge of HRIS systems, report writing tools, and data visualization techniques.     Familiarity with data protection regulations and best practices.     Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.     Experience with popular HRIS systems such as ADP, Lattice, Greenhouse, Learn Upon.     Excellent written and verbal communication skills.     Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.               ?
column11: Data validation, Business transformation, HRIS, Analytical, CRE, Equity, Wellness, Troubleshooting, Information technology, Operations

column2: We are currently seeking Lead Analyst/ Process Lead - ELCM (Employee Lifecycle Management), to join our HR Operations team based in Noida.      We offer you not only a job, but an inspiring journey in a truly global environment where you team up to break down boundaries thanks to the innovation, creativity and pioneer spirit which drive our people.          Main accountabilities:          Your main role will be to manage the creation and maintenance of employee data globally      Assist the Payrolls Team with new hires payroll account enrollment      Process reporting and training      Queue management & maintaining SLAs      Update SOP and other process documents      Ensuring compliance of all internal policies      Process improvement      Providing timely updates to TL and onshore counterparts      Ensure that trackers are inline and up to date for effective reporting.      Create Monthly/ Quarterly Analysis and reports for senior business HR leadership.          About You          A bachelor's degree is required or masters degree in HR or Business related field preferred      Should have 6-10 yrs experience in HR Operations with ERP tool like Oracle-HCM or SAP      Good communication, analytical and management skills      Effective/Accurate and timely reporting skills      Good command on MS Office applications (MS-Excel, MS-Word)      Ability to multi task and should be a self-starter      Ability to handle difficult client situations and derive strategic solutions      Proficient in the use of Microsoft Office (Excel, Outlook, Powerpoint, and Word)      Have strong attention to detail coupled with excellent organizational and documenting skills      Ability to work well independently as well as within a team      Possess superior time management and problem-solving skills      Excellent communication and presentation skills      High level of interpersonal skills and integrity and be a solid team player

column2: The Sr. Associate- plays a key role in supporting all the PC functions. - They will collaborate with cross-functional teams to foster a positive work environment, drive employee engagement, and contribute to the overall success of the organisation.          A day in the life of a Senior Associate - People Culture          Working closely with the Team Leader on day-to-day HR operations          Assisting the team leader in talent acquisition - review resumes for assigned requisitions, co-ordinate interview schedules and conduct interviews for interns and juniors as and when required          Assisting the Team Leader in Learning Development Initiatives          Manage the entire employee life cycle from entry to exit          Take complete ownership of onboarding and exit processes          Creating and maintaining employee documentation and employee records i.e Employee masters, Employment Contracts, NDA, IP Release, Confirmations, Exit Forms etc.          Research and ideate innovative employee engagement activities in line with our values with the Team Leader          Communicating with external partners managing vendors          Being the first point of contact for employees on any HR related queries          Stay updated on relevant employment laws and ensure HR policies and procedures are in compliance          Assisting the accounts finance team with payroll          Qualities and skill sets we would like for you to showcase          2+ years of experience in HR generalist roles in a media/ advertising start up          Solid understanding of HR principles, practices, and employment laws          Excellent communication and interpersonal skills          Strong organisational and time-management abilities          Ability to maintain a high level of confidentiality          Solution and detail oriented          Target driven and able to work in a fast-paced and dynamic environment

column2: We are seeking a motivated HR Associate with up to 1 year of experience to join our dynamic team. As an HR Associate, you will play a vital role in supporting the human resources department in various functions, including recruitment, onboarding, employee relations, and HR administration. Your responsibilities will involve assisting with the development and implementation of HR policies, conducting initial candidate screenings, coordinating interviews, and maintaining personnel records. Additionally, you will have the opportunity to contribute to fostering a positive workplace culture and employee engagement initiatives.              Requirements:            To excel in this role, you should possess a Bachelor's degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field, or equivalent work experience     You should have a solid understanding of HR principles and practices, excellent communication skills, and strong attention to detail     Adaptability, confidentiality, and a customer-service mindset are essential traits for success     Familiarity with HR software and tools is a plus, and the ability to work collaboratively in a team-oriented environment is highly valued                   Skills:          Basic understanding of HR functions and principles.      Strong written and verbal communication skills.      Attention to detail and strong organizational skills.      Ability to maintain confidentiality and handle sensitive information.      Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint).      Excellent interpersonal skills and a customer-service orientation.      Adaptability and a willingness to learn and grow in the HR field.      Familiarity with HRIS (Human Resources Information Systems) is a plus.      Ability to work effectively in a team and contribute to a positive work culture.

column2: The Sr HRIS Analyst will be part of the HRIS organization            A key element of this role will be to manage all HRMS activity and act as a bridge between HR/Payroll/IT and our external Application Management Support teams to ensure that technical development and performance of Nextracker HR systems meets HR & business needs and in alignment to the HR roadmap      This role will also be in constant communication with various stakeholders and ensuring that interdependent HRIS projects are meeting objectives and timelines      The priority of the role will be the further development of the single source of record for HR data - Workday HCM, maintaining and proactively ensuring consistent, high quality data, and its use to enhance system processes and procedural workflows      This role will be required to address global break/fixes, enhancements, and internally advise on other projects that require integrations with other platforms      On an on-going basis, the role will be required to develop an understanding of stakeholders requirements and deliver improvements and optimization of our systems               Key Success Indicators:          Data integrity and user column2: Job description The Talent Fulfillment /Futurist's role involves a combination of strategic thinking, data analysis, and trend forecasting to help navigate the evolving nature of work and talent needs. The Talent Fulfillment Specialist/Futurist works closely with Internal Staffing & External Hiring teams to enable demand fulfillment at right time and price to meet client needs. Key Responsibilities: Define and set the strategy for meeting demands via internal/external mode for a specific market unit within Advanced Technology Center e.g. a small to medium-sized client group operating unit capability group country in coordination with the GU Recruiting/Internal Staffing lead and ensure that it is in line with the company's business strategy. Collaborate with key stakeholders to understand workforce planning needs and align recruitment efforts accordingly. Develop and implement comprehensive talent acquisition strategies to attract top-tier candidates. Stay abreast of current and emerging trends in technology, economy, demographics, and other relevant fields that impact the workforce. Leverage data analytics to identify patterns and predict future talent-related trends. Workforce Planning:Collaborate with HR and organizational leaders to develop long-term plans for acquiring, developing, and retaining talent based on anticipated future needs. Identify and analyze the skills and competencies that will be in demand in the future, considering technological advancements and industry changes. Diversity & Inclusion:Advocate for diversity and inclusion initiatives, considering the evolving nature of talent dynamics and societal changes. Anticipate and plan for shifts in organizational culture to attract and retain diverse talent Talent Strategy/ Initiatives: Qualification Job QualificationsTalent Creation:Design and implement optimal talent-building methodologies, emphasizing upskilling and reskilling. Curate and execute strategies for identifying, attracting, and retaining top talent.Talent Acquisition:Comprehensive understanding of the external talent marketplace, particularly in information technology and services. Implement optimal hiring practices, enhance the quality of hire, and improve the offer-to-joining ratio. Leverage contingent hiring, gig workforce, and liquid workforce avenues to promptly fill immediate positions.Talent Development:Collaborate with business units, HR partners, and Learning & Development teams to identify future skills requirements. Drive initiatives for employee development, ensuring readiness for emerging and niche technologies.Collaboration/Thought Partnership:Act as a trusted advisor to the business by collaborating with key stakeholders to talent strategies with overall organizational goals.

column2: Artech India is looking for Executive - Human Resource to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey     An Executive in Human Resources (HR) is a professional who plays a critical role in managing and overseeing various HR functions within an organization     They are responsible for implementing HR policies, procedures, and initiatives that support the organization's goals and objectives     Here are the key responsibilities and qualifications associated with the role of an Executive in Human Resources:       Responsibilities:       Recruitment and Talent Acquisition: Coordinate and manage the recruitment and selection process, including job postings, resume screening, interviewing, and candidate evaluation     Collaborate with hiring managers to identify staffing needs and ensure the timely acquisition of qualified candidates     Employee Onboarding and Offboarding: Facilitate the onboarding process for new hires, including conducting orientation sessions, explaining company policies, and ensuring a smooth transition into the organization     Manage offboarding activities, such as exit interviews and separation procedures, to ensure a positive and professional experience for departing employees     Performance Management: Assist in the implementation and administration of performance management programs     Support managers in conducting performance evaluations, setting goals, and providing feedback to employees     Collaborate with managers to address performance issues and develop improvement plans     Employee Relations: Handle employee relations matters by providing guidance, counseling, and conflict resolution support     Investigate and address employee grievances, complaints, and disciplinary issues in accordance with company policies and applicable employment laws     Compensation and Benefits Administration: Assist in the administration of compensation and benefits programs, including salary reviews, bonus programs, and employee benefits enrollment     Collaborate with payroll and finance departments to ensure accurate and timely processing of employee compensation and benefits

column2: As a Contingent Workforce Specialist, you would be responsible for supporting the operations of the contingent labour program and driving operational excellence through partnerships with Epiq s hiring managers, internal team members, and external suppliers     This position will work in alignment with the US-based team to assist in processing onboarding and offboarding tasks, as well as assignment amendments and extensions, releases, and other related activities within the Beeline VMS, time file coordination, program audits, and supporting the contingent workforce shared mailbox     The Contingent Workforce Team plays a crucial role in managing and optimizing the utilization of contingent labour for the company, which includes external talent resources such as temporary workers, contractors, freelancers, and consultants     Epiq operates a self-managed contingent labour program and utilizes a vendor management system (VMS), with key responsibilities for vendor management, onboarding and offboarding of workers, compliance and risk management, performance management, and operational support for our business                 Job Responsibilities:         Monitor the contingent workforce shared inbox and respond as needed to inquiries.     Process contingent worker transactions in related systems (Workday HCM, Beeline VMS, and SAP), such as amendments, extensions, and releases, as well as resolving integration errors.     Assist with weekly time file management using SAP reports.     Create reports using various applications (Workday, Beeline, SAP, and Excel) to provide value-added information to the business.     Assist with the creation and ongoing updates of contingent workforce policies, guidelines, processes, and best practices, including ongoing education to teams and managers.     Provide backup to additional team members managing the full lifecycle of staffing requests from managers.     Perform other duties as assigned by leadership.             Education and Qualifications:         Bachelor s degree or equivalent work experience with contingent workforce program support or a related role in talent acquisition or staffing.     Problem-solving and time management skills to facilitate timely completion of simultaneous projects both independently and with others.     Ability to quickly learn applications and systems.     Demonstrated strength in written and verbal English communication.     Ability to represent Epiq externally in a professional manner and provide excellent customer service both internally and externally.     Ability to think critically and use a broad range of complex information to identify recommendations and solutions.     Curious mindset and drive for process improvement and operational efficiency.     Previous system experience with a VMS or HCM (e.g., Beeline, Workday, etc.) Preferred.     Broad HR background or interest (talent acquisition, compensation, employee relations, etc.) as it pertains to a contingent workforce Preferred.     MS Office 365 proficiency (Outlook and Excel - VLOOKUP s, pivot tables, and formulas).     Ability to work 6pm - 3am IST shift hours.

column2: Job description The Talent Fulfillment /Futurist's role involves a combination of strategic thinking, data analysis, and trend forecasting to help navigate the evolving nature of work and talent needs. The Talent Fulfillment Specialist/Futurist works closely with Internal Staffing & External Hiring teams to enable demand fulfillment at right time and price to meet client needs. Key Responsibilities: Define and set the strategy for meeting demands via internal/external mode for a specific market unit within Advanced Technology Center e.g. a small to medium-sized client group operating unit capability group country in coordination with the GU Recruiting/Internal Staffing lead and ensure that it is in line with the company's business strategy. Collaborate with key stakeholders to understand workforce planning needs and align recruitment efforts accordingly. Develop and implement comprehensive talent acquisition strategies to attract top-tier candidates. Stay abreast of current and emerging trends in technology, economy, demographics, and other relevant fields that impact the workforce. Leverage data analytics to identify patterns and predict future talent-related trends. Workforce Planning:Collaborate with HR and organizational leaders to develop long-term plans for acquiring, developing, and retaining talent based on anticipated future needs. Identify and analyze the skills and competencies that will be in demand in the future, considering technological advancements and industry changes. Diversity & Inclusion:Advocate for diversity and inclusion initiatives, considering the evolving nature of talent dynamics and societal changes. Anticipate and plan for shifts in organizational culture to attract and retain diverse talent Talent Strategy/ Initiatives: Qualification Job QualificationsTalent Creation:Design and implement optimal talent-building methodologies, emphasizing upskilling and reskilling. Curate and execute strategies for identifying, attracting, and retaining top talent.Talent Acquisition:Comprehensive understanding of the external talent marketplace, particularly in information technology and services. Implement optimal hiring practices, enhance the quality of hire, and improve the offer-to-joining ratio. Leverage contingent hiring, gig workforce, and liquid workforce avenues to promptly fill immediate positions.Talent Development:Collaborate with business units, HR partners, and Learning & Development teams to identify future skills requirements. Drive initiatives for employee development, ensuring readiness for emerging and niche technologies.Collaboration/Thought Partnership:Act as a trusted advisor to the business by collaborating with key stakeholders to talent strategies with overall organizational goals.

column2: Skill required:  Payroll - payroll planning and distribution Designation:  senior analyst Qualifications: Any Graduation  Years of Experience: 5-8 Yrs  What would you do? You will be aligned to our Human Resources vertical and will help us in the function that deals with people and people related areas such as recruiting, learning, training, onboarding, compensation and benefits, performance management, organization development and culture. You will be working as a part of HR Operations team which is responsible for providing backend HR services to business operations. HR operations and operational HR services, include administrative services, job analysis, and employee relationship management. The Payroll Planning and Distribution team focuses on distributing employees' pay on time through chosen channels such as banks and execute the distribution of earnings statements either manually or electronically. The team is responsible for addressing queries related to provident fund, new joinee/existing employee mediclaim policies, monthly group payroll reconciliation and for updating monthly resignation, retirement and contract closures. The team is also responsible for resolving payroll problems within the confines of established policies & procedures using relevant payroll system. What are we looking for? HR Analytics  HR Delivery Strategy  HR Operations  HR Policy Development & Maintenance  Prioritization of workload  Written and verbal communication  Numerical ability  CL 11 Minimum 2-4 years of experience/knowledge in Payroll for any country i.e., US, UK, Europe, India, etc. Knowledge of any ERP application including Workday would be plus (i.e., SAP, PeopleSoft)  Compensation Administration Process Design  Roles and Responsibilities:  In this role you are required to do analysis and solving of lower-complexity problems  Your day to day interaction is with peers within Accenture before updating supervisors  In this role you may have limited exposure with clients and/or Accenture management  You will be given moderate level instruction on daily work tasks and detailed instructions on new assignments  The decisions you make impact your own work and may impact the work of others  You will be an individual contributor as a part of a team, with a focused scope of work  Please note that this role may require you to work in rotational shifts Qualification Any Graduation

column2: About ICF: Corporate Functions-including Human Resources, Finance, Legal, Marketing Communications, and Workplace Solutions-- powers Accenture's people across industries and functions to keep our business leading in the New. Join the heart and soul of Accenture, partnering with our extraordinary people to bring innovation into every organization Accenture is an equal opportunities employer and welcomes applications from all sections of society and does not discriminate on grounds of race, religion or belief, ethnic or national origin, disability, age, citizenship, marital, domestic or civil partnership status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other basis as protected by applicable law Job  Summary : The Human Resources Representative Analyst will provide integrated Human Resources services to appropriate groups ensuring that people-related issues are managed effectively.  The HR Generalist will also provide direct HR support to typically 1 or more client teams or entities or geographies of low complexity and or 200-300 supervised people. The Human Resources Generalist may supervise 1 or more Human Resource Coordinator. Key Responsibilities:  Coordinate the performance management and promotion processes ensuring adherence to timelines and accurate and fair reward decisions  Coordinate with Career Counselors and Managers to enable the implementation of performance improvement plans  Coach and advise Career Counselors to ensure effective delivery of difficult messages  Review continuously the performance feedback for individuals within remit in order to anticipate and manage potential performance issues.  Proactively monitor personnel issues or situations  Communicate company-wide initiatives to group supported  Attend community events and promote networking opportunities  Support the career and professional development of all personnel by educating them on the career model providing guidance on career plans based on their goals and the goals of the group  Advice personnel on required and elective training appropriate for development  Monitor the supply of personnel by maintaining personnel information in all appropriate systems and reviewing and following up on all exceptions to chargeability and utilization targets  Develop and distribute reports on a regular basis and upon reque Qualification Accenture is an equal opportunities employer and welcomes applications from all sections of society and does not discriminate on grounds of race, religion or belief, ethnic or national origin, disability, age, citizenship, marital, domestic or civil partnership status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other basis as protected by applicable law Job  Summary : The Human Resources Representative Sr. Analyst will provide integrated Human Resources services to appropriate groups ensuring that people-related issues are managed effectively. The HR Generalist will also provide direct HR support to typically 1 or more client teams or entities or geographies of low complexity and or 800-1000 supervised people. Key Responsibilities:  Coordinate the performance achievement and promotion processes ensuring adherence to timelines and accurate and fair reward decisions  Coordinate with Career Counselors and Managers to enable the implementation of performance improvement plans  Coach and advise Career Counselors to ensure effective delivery of difficult messages  Review continuously the performance feedback for individuals within remit in order to anticipate and manage potential performance issues.  Proactively monitor personnel issues or situations  Communicate company-wide initiatives to group supported  Attend community events and promote networking opportunities  Support the career and professional development of all personnel by educating them on the career model providing guidance on career plans based on their goals and the goals of the group  Advise personnel on required and elective training appropriate for development  Monitor the supply of personnel by maintaining personnel information in all appropriate systems and reviewing and following up on all exceptions to chargeability and utilization targets  Develop and distribute reports on a regular basis and upon request. Qualifications: Postgraduate Human Resources Degree or related experience Knowledge and Skill Requirements:- Hands-on employee relations experience preferred. Excellent oral and written communication skills- Business and Industry knowledge and acumen- Career management or performance management or compensation- Facilitation skills- Coaching- Conflict management- Change management. Good excel skills. OUR COMMITMENT TO YOU:  You'll benefit from our network of global communities and collaborative culture that will help you build technical and functional skills and capabilities. And because we serve more than 40 industries globally, you'll have the opportunity to develop valuable industry-specific expertise.  The scale of our capabilities and client engagements-and the unique way we innovate, operate and deliver value-will give you the opportunity to deepen your existing skills even as you help create the latest technology trends.  You'll have access to leading-edge technology. CALL TO ACTION: If you have a desire to help the world's leading companies and governments, now's the time to join the world's largest and most diversified group of technology, business process and consulting professionals. Be part of a dynamic team of collaborative experts, and help us improve the way the world works and lives

column2: Job  Summary : Are you passionate about people analytics and enhancing people experiences? Do you thrive in a collaborative & agile environment where you can make a meaningful impact? If so, we have an exciting opportunity for you to join our team as an HR Service Delivery Specialist. This role is housed in HR Service & excellence compliance team which is part of the India Corporate Functions HR team in Accenture. Working with this team provides you with an opportunity to work on complex & large scale HR transformation projects We are seeking a dynamic and experienced individual to join our. In this role, you will play a pivotal role in driving HR transformation initiatives and leveraging analytics skills to understand and provide attrition insights to the leadership. You will work closely with HR leaders, Shared services, process teams and data analytics team to implement solutions, and drive change within the organization. Key Responsibilities: Co-own strategy & solution designing along with the leads of HR transformation projects. Identify areas for improvement and develop strategies to address them. Drive end to end project management including implementation, change management & governance of HR transformation initiatives aimed at enhancing employee experience. Collaborate with Business HR teams and cross-functional teams to drive projects & deliverables. Drive change management efforts to ensure successful adoption of new HR processes, technologies, and practices. Monitor and evaluate the effectiveness of programs and initiatives, making data-driven recommendations for continuous improvement. Build storyboards & proposals to drive effective stakeholder discussions. Utilize analytics skills to analyze attrition data, identify trends, and monitor key metrics related to attrition providing regular reports and actionable insights to HR leadership. Oversee the collection, integration, and management of attrition data from multiple sources, ensuring data accuracy and completeness. Qualification Qualifications & Skills required: Bachelors in any specialization & post-graduates (specialized preferably in HR) from Tier I & II B-schools. 4-7 years of experience in HR transformation, organizational development, HR business partner or related areas, with a focus on driving change and improving employee experience. Strong analytical skills with experience in attrition analysis. Excellent communication and presentation & storyboarding skills, with the ability to translate complex data and insights into actionable recommendations. Demonstrated ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams and influence stakeholders at all levels of the organization. Strong project management skills with the ability to manage multiple initiatives simultaneously and drive them to successful completion. Proficiency in MS excel & PowerPoint.

column2: 5C Network  is looking for Human Resource Executive  to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey.The Human Resource Executive is responsible for supporting various human resource functions and initiatives within the organization. They will assist in recruitment and selection, employee onboarding, benefits administration, employee relations, performance management, and HR compliance. The Human Resource Executive plays a critical role in promoting a positive work culture and ensuring the smooth operation of HR processes. Key Responsibilities: Assist in the recruitment and selection process, including job postings, resume screening, scheduling interviews, and conducting background checks. Coordinate and facilitate new employee onboarding and orientation programs, ensuring a smooth transition for new hires. Maintain accurate employee records and HR databases, including personnel files, benefits information, and performance evaluations. Support benefits administration, including enrollment, changes, and inquiries related to employee health insurance, retirement plans, and other employee benefits. Assist in the implementation and administration of performance management processes, including goal-setting, performance appraisals, and employee development plans. Handle employee inquiries and provide guidance on HR policies, procedures, and benefits programs. Support employee relations initiatives, including resolving employee complaints, conducting investigations, and assisting with disciplinary actions when necessary. Assist in the coordination of training and development programs, including identifying training needs, scheduling sessions, and tracking attendance. Stay updated on employment laws, regulations, and HR best practices to ensure compliance and make recommendations for policy updates as needed. Support HR projects and initiatives, such as employee engagement programs, diversity and inclusion efforts, and culture-building activities. Qualifications and Requirements: Bachelor's degree in human resources, business administration, or a related field. Additional HR certifications or coursework is advantageous. Proven experience in human resources or related roles, with a strong understanding of HR processes and practices. Knowledge of employment laws, regulations, and HR compliance. Familiarity with HRIS (Human Resource Information System) and other HR software tools. Strong interpersonal and communication skills, with the ability to build rapport and establish effective working relationships with employees at all levels. Excellent organizational and time management skills, with the ability to prioritize tasks and meet deadlines. Detail-oriented with a high level of accuracy in handling HR records and data. Ability to maintain confidentiality and handle sensitive information with discretion. Strong problem-solving and conflict resolution skills, with the ability to address employee concerns and issues effectively. Ability to work independently and as part of a team, collaborating with colleagues to achieve HR goals and objectives. Proficiency in MS Office applications, particularly Excel, Word, and PowerPoint. Continuous learning mindset, staying updated on HR trends, best practices, and industry advancements.

column2: Role & responsibilities   Recruitment and Staffing: Assist in developing job descriptions and posting job openings on various platforms. Screen and shortlist candidates, schedule interviews, and coordinate with hiring managers. Conduct initial interviews and participate in the selection process. Handle pre-employment screening and background checks. Onboarding and Orientation: Facilitate the onboarding process for new hires, including documentation and orientation programs. Ensure new employees are integrated into the company culture and understand their roles and responsibilities. Employee Relations: Act as a point of contact for employee inquiries and concerns, providing guidance and support. Assist in resolving employee issues and conflicts in a timely and effective manner. Promote a positive and inclusive workplace culture. Performance Management: Support the performance appraisal process, including the collection and tracking of employee performance data. Assist managers in setting performance goals and developing performance improvement plans. Facilitate employee development programs and training initiatives. Compliance and Record-Keeping: Ensure HR policies and procedures comply with legal standards and industry best practices. Maintain accurate and up-to-date employee records, including personnel files and HR databases. Assist with internal and external audits and reporting requirements. HR Administration: Manage HR-related documentation and correspondence. Prepare HR reports and presentations as required. Coordinate HR projects and initiatives, such as employee engagement surveys and wellness programs. HR Strategy and Planning: Contribute to the development and implementation of HR strategies and initiatives aligned with business objectives. Participate in HR planning and policy development. Preferred candidate profile   Bachelors degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or related field. 2+ years of experience in HR or a related field. Knowledge of HR principles, practices, and employment laws. Strong interpersonal and communication skills. Proficiency in HR software and Microsoft Office Suite. Ability to handle confidential information with discretion. Excellent organizational and time management skills.

Your Contribution             Working alongside the People & Culture Managers to update and implement HR strategies and initiatives aligned with the overall business strategy         Partner with leaders and team members as an effective business-enabler to create value-add through effectively planned and deployed people management practices         Building a culture of inclusion and accountability, reinforcing our values and vision         Manage the entire employee life cycle from recruitment to offboarding leveraging systems and teams, ensuring all process run optimally          Be the custodian of your designated country / region re culture, policies, and practices and constantly re-evaluate and update based on industry trends and practices         Act as the advocate for leading the talent management and development plans for business units with a focus on enhancing the quality of leaders and managers, building skills and capabilities of the workforce, and ensuring succession strength.         Guide and coach managers on how to appropriately manage and resolve complex HR issues (eg, performance management and total rewards).         Manage the performance review framework, processes and resources including providing input into the design and implementation of our new performance system         Proactively look at how we'reward and recognize our people and implement initiatives to drive the right results, behavior and culture         Assist in payroll preparation by providing relevant data             Your Environment               You will be working in a highly collaborative environment at Adventus       io     This position is office based, and position holder should    be willing to work on alternate Saturdays in response to the needs of the business and the position      You will be provided with the necessary tools and equipment to carry out the role

This internship provides an excellent opportunity for individuals pursuing a career in Human Resources to gain hands-on experience in various HR functions. Data Cleansing: Identify and rectify inconsistencies or errors in financial data, working closely with stakeholders to maintain data integrity throughout migration processes.      Financial Data Validation: Develop and execute validation protocols to ensure the accuracy of migrated financial data, conducting reconciliations and resolving discrepancies. Documentation: Create comprehensive documentation outlining data migration processes, methodologies, and key decisions, ensuring a transparent and auditable process.      Post-Migration Analysis: Conduct post-migration analysis to evaluate the effectiveness of data migration processes, identifying areas for improvement and implementing corrective actions. Education Training          Inter CA/ B.com /M.com

column2: AROH Foundation is looking for Community Resource Persons-Sukma Chhattisgarh to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey      As a Community Resource Person, you will serve as a vital link between community members and the resources available to support their needs and well-being      Your role involves building relationships, assessing community needs, and connecting individuals and groups with appropriate resources and services      You will work collaboratively with local organizations, government agencies, and other stakeholders to identify gaps in services and develop strategies to address them      Your efforts will contribute to the overall health, resilience, and cohesion of the community        Key Responsibilities:        Community Engagement: Engage with community members to build trust, rapport, and understanding of their needs, concerns, and aspirations      Foster a sense of belonging and ownership among diverse groups within the community      Needs Assessment: Conduct comprehensive assessments of community needs through surveys, interviews, focus groups, and other methods      Identify priority areas such as healthcare, education, housing, employment, social services, and cultural enrichment      Resource Identification: Research and compile information about available resources, programs, and services offered by government agencies, non-profit organizations, religious institutions, and other community partners      Maintain up-to-date knowledge of eligibility criteria, application procedures, and contact information for each resource      Referral and Assistance: Provide guidance, support, and referrals to community members seeking assistance or information      Assist individuals in navigating complex systems and accessing the appropriate resources to meet their specific needs      Advocacy and Empowerment: Advocate for the needs and rights of community members, particularly those who are marginalized, vulnerable, or underserved      Empower individuals and groups to advocate for themselves and participate in decision-making processes that affect their lives      Capacity Building: Facilitate training workshops, educational seminars, and skill-building activities to enhance the capacity of community members to address their own needs and support one another      Foster leadership development and community resilience      Collaboration and Networking: Build and maintain partnerships with local organizations, government agencies, businesses, educational institutions, and other stakeholders to leverage resources and coordinate efforts      Participate in coalitions, task forces, and committees focused on community development and social justice      Documentation and Reporting: Maintain accurate records of client interactions, resource referrals, program outcomes, and community feedback      Prepare reports, presentations, and grant proposals as required to demonstrate impact and secure funding

column2: An HR Professional is responsible for executing various human resources (HR) functions within an organization. Key responsibilities include:     Recruiting and staffing: sourcing, screening, and hiring new employees.     Employee relations: addressing and resolving employee concerns, complaints, and conflicts.     Performance management: conducting performance evaluations and providing feedback to employees.     Employee development: creating and implementing employee training programs and career development plans.     Compensation and benefits: administering employee compensation and benefits programs, such as salaries, bonuses, and insurance.     Compliance: ensuring compliance with federal and state employment laws and regulations.     Policy development and administration: creating, updating, and communicating HR policies and procedures.     Employee records management: maintaining accurate and up-to-date employee files and records.     Diversity and inclusion: promoting and fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace culture.     Other HR-related tasks as assigned by management.       Qualifications:       Strong knowledge of federal and state employment laws and regulations.     Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build strong relationships with employees at all levels of the organization.     Good organizational and time management skills, with the ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks effectively.     Experience with HR information systems (HRIS) and other HR technology solutions.     Ability to maintain confidentiality and handle sensitive employee information.     Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to identify and resolve HR-related issues.
column11: HR

column2: Identifying manpower requirements, taking them up to the HR Head for approval     Creating job descriptions for required manpower, advertising them to get best candidates and handling the employment process     Creating and managing schedules, meetings, interviews, and other HR activities     Reviewing CVs, shortlisting candidates and assisting in the recruitment process     Liasioning with external recruitment agencies for closing positions on time     Handling the orientation of new employees     Conducting training sessions for old and new employees of the organization     Ensuring that the employees are satisfied with their role in the organisation, the work environment     Handling performance management procedure and appraisals is a key task in hr executive job description.     Maintaining records, attendance and data of each employee and providing them to the management team when required     Conducting exit interviews with outgoing employees.     Handling employee grievances, if any and updating the employees with policies, compliances, and regulations     Overseeing safety and health of the employees     Handling the orientation of new employees is one of the key points that should be included in all hr executive job description     Conducting SWAT analysis of each employee and counselling them on the areas that need improvement     Handling and managing data/records of each employee of the organization.

column2: Vaidyaratnam Oushadhasala Private Limited is looking for HR Interns to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey     We are seeking dynamic and motivated individuals to join our team as HR Interns at Idea Usher     This internship provides a valuable opportunity for aspiring HR professionals to gain practical experience in a fast-paced and innovative work environment     Responsibilities:Recruitment Support:Assist in the end-to-end recruitment process, including job posting, resume screening, and coordinating interviews     Support the onboarding process for new hires     Employee Engagement:Contribute to the planning and execution of employee engagement initiatives and activities     Assist in organizing team-building events and programs     HR Administration:Provide administrative support in maintaining HR records, updating employee databases, and managing documentation     Assist in the preparation of HR-related reports and presentations     Talent Development:Support training and development initiatives by coordinating training sessions and tracking participation     Assist in the implementation of learning and development programs     Employee Relations:Contribute to fostering a positive work environment by addressing employee queries and concerns     Participate in employee relations activities and initiatives     Compliance Assistance:Assist in ensuring HR practices comply with local, state, and federal regulations     Support the implementation of HR policies and procedures     Data Analysis:Compile and analyze HR data to identify trends and provide insights     Assist in preparing reports for HR metrics and key performance indicators

column2: PROPERTYYY.com - Simplifying Real Estate in India is looking for Human Resource to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey      A Human Resource (HR) job description typically involves tasks such as managing employee recruitment and selection, administering employee benefits and compensation, developing and implementing personnel policies and procedures, maintaining employee records, providing employee training and development opportunities, and resolving employee relations issues      HR professionals may also be responsible for ensuring compliance with employment laws and regulations, as well as contributing to overall organizational strategy and planning      Effective communication, attention to detail, and strong interpersonal skills are often required for success in an HR role
